Musical artist

Jonathan Lee (born 26 April 1982) is an English singer and actor. Lee is the youngest member of pop group S Club, which disbanded in April 2003, before reuniting in March 2023. With a long career in musical theatre, he has taken on roles in more than 17 productions, including the West End shows Les Misérables "Les Misérables (musical)") and Jersey Boys.

Actions [...] In 2008 Lee voiced the part of Max, in the British Disney Channel cartoon series Famous 5: On the Case. Over Christmas and New Year's 2008–09 he appeared at The White Rock Theatre, Hastings, performing the leading role in the pantomime Peter Pan "Peter Pan (pantomime)"). Both Lee and the show were well received. Later in 2009 Lee appeared as Billy Fury in Nick Moran's new film Telstar "Telstar (film)"). On 22 May 2010 he appeared in BBC One's Casualty "Casualty (TV series)") as Craig, who is diagnosed with motor neurone disease. He played John in the internationally acclaimed musical Tomorrow Morning "Tomorrow Morning (musical)") by Laurence Mark Wythe at the Landor Theatre in London. Over the following Christmas and New Year's, Lee appeared at the New Victoria Theatre, Woking, as Prince

data.title: Lee Jun-ho - Wikipedia
data.snippet:
Lee is widely regarded among the best idol-turned-actors, with him being ranked first among all male idol-actors by a 2023 poll of entertainment insiders. He is the only idol-actor to win Best Actor at the Baeksang Arts Awards and the Korea PD Awards, as well as the Grand Prize for Actor of the Year at the Asia Artist Awards and the APAN Star Awards. Lee has been cited as a role model by many younger idols and actors including Jay B, Jinyoung "Jinyoung (entertainer, born 1994)"), Dahyun, Kang Daniel and Kim Jae-won "Kim Jae-won (actor, born 2001)").

## Discography

[edit]

Main article: Lee Jun-ho discography

For Lee's work with 2PM, see 2PM discography.

 One (2015) "One (Junho album)")
 Two (2019) "Two (Junho album)")

## Filmography

[edit] [...] In 2017, Lee starred in the hit office comedy drama Good Manager. He was praised for his villainous acting in the drama as the arrogant director of finances and won the Excellence Award for an actor in a mid-length drama at the KBS Drama Awards, marking his first acting accolade. The same year, Lee landed his first lead role in JTBC's romantic melodrama series Rain or Shine "Rain or Shine (TV series)"). He portrayed a psychologically scarred and physically traumatized survivor of a fatal incident, losing over 7 kilograms to fit the role. Lee also participated in the soundtrack for the show, performing the track "What Words Are Needed#Original_soundtrack "Rain or Shine (TV series)")." [...] In November 2021, after completing his mandatory military service, he starred in the historical romance drama The Red Sleeve, playing the role of Crown Prince Yi San, alongside Lee Se-young as Royal Consort Uibin Seong. The drama became a success, sweeping 8 awards at the 2021 MBC Drama Awards, with him getting Top Excellence Award. Lee was the first idol-actor to win Best Actor at 2022's Korea PD Awards, and also won the awards for Most Popular Actor and Best Actor – Television at the 58th Baeksang Arts Awards, becoming the first idol to win the latter. Lee was also the first idol-actor to win Top Excellence Award, Actor in a miniseries at the 2022 APAN Star Awards and first-idol actor to win Grand Prize (Daesang) for Actor of the year at the 2022 Asia Artist Awards. Lee ranked first

data.title: Lee Mack - Wikipedia
data.snippet:
Mack then became a Bluecoat entertainer at the Pontins holiday resort at Hemsby in Norfolk. He was sacked after appearing on stage drunk one night, forgetting a joke and insulting an audience member. He then worked for six months at Pontins in Morecambe.

Mack went on to have various other jobs, and performed his first "open mic" slot in 1994, while studying at Brunel University, from where he graduated with a degree in Drama. Within 18 months he was a full-time comedian.

## Career

[edit] [...] Lee Gordon McKillop (born 4 August 1968), known by his stage name Lee Mack, is an English comedian and actor. Mack’s better known work includes creating, writing and starring in the sitcom Not Going Out, and featuring as a team captain on the panel show Would I Lie to You? "Would I Lie to You? (British game show)"). In 2022, he began hosting the game show The 1% Club.

data.title: Jason Lee - Wikipedia
data.snippet: Jason Michael Lee (born April 25, 1970) is an American actor, filmmaker, photographer, and former professional skateboarder. He is known for playing Earl Hickey in the television comedy series My Name Is Earl, for which he was nominated for the Golden Globe Award for Best Actor in a Television Series – Musical or Comedy in 2005 and 2006. He is also known for his roles in Kevin Smith films such as Mallrats (1995), Chasing Amy (1997), Dogma "Dogma (film)") (1999), Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back (2001), Jersey Girl "Jersey Girl (2004 film)") (2004), Clerks II (2006), Cop Out "Cop Out (2010 film)") (2010), and Jay and Silent Bob Reboot (2019). Lee won the Independent Spirit Award for Best Supporting Male for his performance in Chasing Amy.
